name: Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles
description:
WavsGB provide self-drive wheelchair accessible vehicles for hire suitable for transporting a wheelchair passenger. Staff are expertly trained in these types of vehicle and can assist with selecting the correct vehicle and showing you how to load and secure a wheelchair for transport.

The long-term hire service allows you to hire a vehicle over a longer period of time with no obligation and greater flexibility should your circumstances change. Long term hire is suitable for patients requiring long term care, organisations and care homes.

Use the vehicle as your own for as long as you need, there is no maximum term. Simply call us and we'll collect it when you no longer require it.

Nationwide delivery for hire periods of 7 days or more. Various types and size of vehicle available.

Long term hire benefits:

Competitively priced hire
Flexible hire terms
Easy manageable payments
Cancel at any time
Replacement vehicles provided
Full service maintenance and repair
Breakdown cover included
Change vehicles easily to suit changing needs

name: Windmill Hill City Farm
description:
Windmill Hill City Farm aims to improve the lives of local people through its services and facilities. It runs activities for people with health and social care needs, gives opportunities for personal development through courses and volunteering and hosts other organisations with similar aims and services. 

The café is open and events have returned to the farm. See the what’s on page to find out what’s coming up.

Visit our farm shop for goodies to take home with you, or place your order via click and collect and we’ll have it ready for you.

Nursery:

Set in four and a half acres of green space, the city farm nursery provides a unique experience for children (0-5 years) to learn and flourish through interacting with nature.

The nursery building itself was specifically designed with this purpose in mind and each room opens out into private gardens and play areas.

Choosing the city farm nursery for your child, doesn’t just mean welly walks, mud kitchens and egg collecting – you’ll also become part of a thriving local community, where parents are encouraged to get involved.

organization.name: Windmill Hill City Farm
organization.description:
Windmill Hill City Farm is a 4.5-acre green space in South Bristol, 20-minutes’ walk from Bristol City Centre. It offers education, recreation and therapy for local people and is a vital hub for the community.

Facilities on site include a café and farm shop, children’s nursery, community & kitchen gardens, a range of farm animals, picnic and play areas, indoor and outdoor spaces to hire and a 5-a-side football pitch

name: Withywood - Activity Group
description: The activity groups gives people affected by dementia the opportunity to take part in structured activities. Run by a facilitator and supported by volunteers, who encourages and supports people to take part, the groups are also a chance to relax and socialise.

organization.name: Alzheimer’s Society (Bristol & South Glos)
organization.description: Alzheimer’s Society is the UK’s leading dementia charity. We campaign for change, fund research to find a cure and support people living with dementia today.

name: Withywood Church Services
description:
Withywood Church provides a haven of peace at the heart of The Withywood Centre. The chapel is open for prayer every weekday from 8:30am to 5pm. Everyone in the community is welcome to visit the chapel.

​

Services are held every Sunday at 10:30am with various groups and activities on other days.

​

Withywood Church holds a Sacred Space on the 2nd Sunday of every month at 6pm. If you have had a busy/hectic month, come and join us for some time of worship. Why not give it a try?

​

The Church is available for for various family celebrations. Please Contact us to enquire.

​

Withywood Church is an ecumenical partnership between the Anglican and Methodist Churches.

organization.name: Withywood Centre
organization.description:
The Withywood Centre is a £5.3m Community Building owned and managed by South Bristol Church and Community Trust (SBCCT). Located on Queen's Road in Withywood, the Centre is a multifunctional community asset. The Withywood Centre is situated along the number 75 bus route and has free car parking for up to 75 vehicles. Bristol Temple Meads train station is only 15 minutes away by taxi. 

 

The building is fully accessible and is home to numerous service providers including:

Megabytes Café

Withywood Church

Amelia Nutt Clinic

South Bristol Advice Services (SBAS)

Age UK Bristol

Community Learning Difficulty Team (CLDT)

IntoUniversity

 

The Centre is a hub of activity hosting various support groups, sporting groups, recreational groups and community groups. 

 

Boasting beautiful gardens, the Centre is a safe, clean and modern venue that can accommodate meetings, conferences, clubs, organisations and private parties.

name: Womankind Deaf Counselling Service
description: Womankind Deaf Counselling Service Counselling service for deaf women in British Sign Language. Are you: ? Struggling with day to day living? ? Worried, anxious or stressed? ? Feeling isolated? ? Bereaved? Sometimes it can help to talk to someone about how you feel and what might be troubling you… We are offering a free and confidential counselling service for Deaf Women with a qualified and experienced Counsellor in central Bristol. You can contact us on by using: ? Text relay on our 24 hour message service 0845 458 2914 OR 0117 9166461 ? Text 07971345263 ? Email info@womankindbristol.org.uk

name: Womankind, Bristol Women's Therapy Centre
description:
Womankind, Bristol Women's Therapy Centre
Provides a helpline, counselling, group therapy and on-going support for women in the Bristol area. Specialist and confidential services are provided to women experiencing mental health problems, including depression, anxiety, stress, domestic abuse, problems arising from past physical, emotional and sexual abuse, rape, self injury and relationship difficulties. Womankind aims to help women improve their mental health and wellbeing by providing high quality services that are accessible and safe.
Services Provided:
Telephone Helpline: provides confidential and non-judgemental listening support for any woman experiencing emotional distress, including specific advice and support for women experiencing domestic or sexual
abuse. It also provides information and signposting to services offered by Womankind and other organisations. 24hr message service.
Our services include:

General counselling - Up to six months counselling if you live in Bristol and can’t afford to pay for therapy yourself. We ask for a donation towards the cost of your counselling sessions depending on what you can afford to contribute. Please don’t worry if you can’t afford to make a donation as we can still help you.

         If you would like more information, please contact our helpline on 0117 916641 or 0345 4582914

Specialist Rape and Sexual Abuse Counselling - Free and confidential counselling if you have experienced recent or historic rape, sexual assault or sexual abuse. This service is for women in Bristol and delivered in partnership with the Bristol Sexual Violence Consortium and SARSAS, (Somerset and Avon Rape and Sexual Abuse Support Service).If you would like to make an appointment to see someone, please call our partner agency SARSAS on 0808 801 0456 or 0117 929 8868 who can discuss your needs and refer you into a service which best suits your support needs.
Specialist Abuse Counselling - If you’ve experienced violence, abuse or exploitation then we can support you with one to one counselling from therapists who are experienced in helping people who have suffered trauma. Our Safer Women’s Project is a free and confidential service for all women including refugee, trafficked and asylum seeking women.Can’t speak English? Don’t worry as we have trusted and confidential interpreters.

Please see a film here about the services offered by Womankind and our partner agencies in the Safer Women’s Project.
If you would like more information, please contact our helpline on 0117 916641 or 0345 4582914
Private Counselling - If you’re working and can afford to pay, then we have a private counselling service (evenings only). Counselling sessions are from £30.If you would like more information, please contact our helpline on 0117 916641 or 0345 4582914
Group Therapy - We offer groups for women of all ages, cultures and backgrounds. A therapy group can provide you with longer term support and can help you better understand and manage difficulties? such as depression or anxiety. In the safe environment of the group, you can take the time you need to work through difficulties with other women. Being listened to and understood can also help you feel less isolated.Our groups run weekly on Monday mornings and Thursday afternoons and are held in Central Bristol. Our premises are accessible with a ramp, lift, parking and accessible toilet (on ground floor). You can also tell us of any other access needs you have, so that we can ensure these are supported.

You will need to live in Bristol and be unable to afford to pay for therapy yourself to join one of these groups. We may ask for a donation towards the cost of your sessions depending on what you can afford to contribute. Please don’t worry if you can’t afford to make a donation as we can still help you.
If you would like more information about our groups, please contact our helpline on 0117 916 641 or 0345 458 2914.

 

Befriending Service - Our befriending service supports women to get back on their feet. A volunteer befriender can provide you with company, a listening ear and a shoulder to lean on. Befrienders can help you to get out and about, develop new interests, improve your routine, build new friendships and support networks, increase your confidence and self-esteem.

We support isolated women living in South Gloucestershire and Bristol to improve their mental health and wellbeing. Our Bristol service is for women have been raped or sexually abused.
If you would like to have a befriender, please ask your support worker, sexual violence worker or a health care professional to make a referral.
If you would like more information, please contact our helpline on 0117 916 6461 or 0345 458 2914.




We also have Volunteer opportunities in administration, helpline and befriending. Full training and expenses provided.

Our services are in high demand and you may have to wait a while before you get an appointment. Our helpline service can provide you with on-going support whilst you are waiting.

https://youtu.be/-tMcHE8BRYc
Fees:
General counselling and group therapy: women may be asked for a donation towards the cost depending on what they can afford to pay.  No one is turned away if they are unable to make a donation.

A full fee-paying service is also available.

name: Women of a Certain Stage
description:
Are you or your colleagues:

​​

  • Suffering in silence with anxiety, brain fog or roller coaster emotions?​

​

  • Finding it difficult to concentrate on tasks or missing deadlines?​

​

  • Getting easily frustrated or angry?​

​

  • Finding it hard to focus or make decisions?
    ​​

  • Struggling with disorientating and debilitating hot flushes and night sweats?

​


Women of a Certain Stage specialise in resolving the impacts of menopause symptoms by focusing on improving wellbeing and morale. 

​

This is done by workplace training, raising awareness in the media and specialist coaching and mentoring experiences.

name: Women's Crisis House
description:
Who we are

The Women's Crisis House (also known as Link House) provides a safe place for women in mental health crisis to stay. Women can stay at the house for up to four weeks.

People staying at the house benefit from:

• 24 hour support
• Someone to talk to
• An individual support plan for their future
• Daily activities and group work
• Advice on benefits, employment, housing, relationships, cooking and looking after yourself and building resilience.

We can help women in Bristol experiencing a mental health crisis who need time away from home and would otherwise have to go into hospital. We can also help women to leave psychiatric hospital earlier in their recovery journey.

Who can refer

Women can self-refer or be referred by a health professional, such as a GP, nurse or care co-ordinator.

Where we are

The Women's Crisis House is located in a residential area in north Bristol.

Opening times: The Women's Crisis House provides 24/7 supported accommodation. The service can be contacted on the telephone number above between 8am and 6pm daily.

organization.name: Missing Link
organization.description:
We provide a range of housing and support to women who have either acute or long term mental health needs.
We support women who are homeless, sleeping rough or whose housing is at risk because of their mental health issues. We also provide a direct access service, Link House, as a preventative or alternative to psychiatric admission.
We specialise in working with women who have complex needs including substance misuse, offending and self-harm. Our support has a holistic focus looking at health, social care and mental health. All our support is tailored to each woman’s needs, and builds on their individual strengths to help them to improve their well-being, secure their housing and sustain their long term recovery.

name: Women's Only Community Tennis - Eastville Park
description: Come and try tennis and meet new people at this relaxed informal session which takes place at the outdoor tennis courts in Eastville Park. We particularly welcome people seeking asylum and refugees to these fun and friendly tennis sessions. No experience necessary, all equipment is provided. Please note this is a women's only session, but it is facilitated by a male coach.

name: Woodland Wellbeing Project
description: Weekly nature based wellbeing sessions for people struggling with their mental health and with isolation. The project is open to people of all genders, aged 18 and over living or working in South Gloucestershire. Free transport from Kingswood and Yate.

name: Yate Community Choir
description: Yate Community Choir Yate Community Choir meet Thursday evenings - 7.30 - 9pm at Ridgewood Community Centre, Yate. Lots of fun singing harmony from all round the world. Open to all. New members welcome at any time.

name: Yate Leisure Centre
description:
Our Gym at Yate is home to the very latest in strength and conditioning equipment, including the latest innovations from Technogym with new running, climbing, cycling, and rowing machines. Customers at Yate also have the additional benefit of Biocircuit Studio and a dedicated Kinesis area.

Our studios offer an extensive range of fitness classes, from the more traditional aerobics and body conditioning classes to virtual online sessions as well as offering yoga and pool based fitness sessions. Whilst our new dedicated group cycling studio offers a virtual ‘real-road’ cycling sensation in an inspirational environment.

FACILITIES

  • Fully kitted out Gym
  • BIOCIRCUIT
  • 1 Fitness Studios
  • 25m Main Swimming Pool (includes pool hoist)
  • Small Pool
  • 7 Badminton Court Main Hall
  • Dedicated Group Cycling Studio
  • 3 Meeting Rooms
  • Party Rooms
  • Atlantis Softplay 
  • 3 Squash Courts
  • SOHO Coffee Co.
  • A range of Accessibility Equipment and Changing Facilities
  • Therapy Health & Beauty Clinic

  • PRICE LIST​​​​​​​

ACCESSIBILITY FOR OUR DISABLED CUSTOMERS

We have a range of equipment to help customers change comfortably, and get in and out of pools safely. Our gyms have specific equipment installed to aid customers with a disability.

Yate offers the following facilities:

  • Dedicated parking spaces for disabled badge holders
  • Where height adjustable changing stretchers are provided full room hoist coverage is given with overhead tracking systems for use with customer’s own slings.
  • Accessible toilet
  • Mobile hoist
  • Height-adjustable changing table (full room hoist coverage)
  • Dedicated disabled changing room (poolside)
  • Poolside hoist
  • Lift to first floor

If you have a specific requirement and need further assistance please contact us on 03003330300 and we will try our best to help you.

Yate Active Lifestyle Centre,
Kennedy Way,
Yate,
BS37 4DQ

organization.name: Circadian Trust/Active Lifestyles
organization.description:
We are Circadian Trust; an innovative, social enterprise operating as an independent charity, which successfully manages leisure facilities across South Gloucestershire.
We run and operate our 5 Active Lifestyle Centres, to bring our mission ‘Inspiring Active Lifestyles’ to life.

name: Yate Men's Shed
description:
Yate Men’s Shed

Yate Men’s Shed is a community-based organization that provides a venue for members of our community to meet in a friendly and convivial environment away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life, to pursue their practical hobbies / interests and to socialise. Our members have a broad spectrum of skills and interests which we are able to share and expand on.

We hold two afternoon sessions a week at Yate Parish Hall, Station Road, where members can use the workshop facilities or just drink tea and have a chat. The sessions help reduce loneliness and isolation, but most importantly, they are fun.

Men typically find it more difficult to build social connections than women, and unlike women many men may have a limited network of friends with whom they can share personal worries and concerns. Whilst not the case for all men, for many, when retirement eventually comes, it can feel like their personal identity and purpose is lost. The Men’s Sheds community helps to change this by reducing feelings of isolation and loneliness, enabling members to gain a new sense of purpose and belonging.

So, if you would like to join us, do come along or give us a call you would be very welcome.

organization.name: Yate Men's Shed
organization.description: Community spaces for men to connect, converse and create.

name: Yoga for Fitness & Wellbeing
description: These yoga classes in Fishponds and Staple Hill will help you keep fit, healthy and injury-free as time goes on. Accessible, effective, fun and suitable for your physical health and mental wellbeing. Our yoga is proven to boost your fitness, improve your flexibility and balance, build your strength and energy levels in a safe, mindful and effective way and help relax you and bring calm to alleviate the symptoms of anxiety, stress and other mental health issues. So you'll leave feeling fitter, stronger and with a spring in your step! And our classes are ideal for beginners and those returning to yoga.

name: Young People's Drug & Alcohol Service
description: Young People's Drug & Alcohol Service We provide confidential and holistic advice, information and support to young people and their families around substance use (alcohol, illegal and legal substances). We can see young people at school or in other community settings and offer on-going 1:1 support and harm reduction advice.

description: Young Persons Gambling Project Free confidential advice and support for young people in Bristol who are affected by their own or someone else's gambling. We provide help for young people at the earliest opportunity to prevent more serious problems occurring.

Addiction Recovery Agency

name: Your Care South West Ltd Home Support Services
description:
We are a family run introduction agency based in South Glos. We have been operating for almost 8 years now and have many happy clients and personal assistants.

Your Care was established back in 2014 by Tina Westlake who was frustrated with the outdated care system decided to set up a business to offer a bespoke support service to people who wanted flexible, reliable care provided by people who like her would look after them as if they were a family member and most importantly visits would be provided by the SAME carers each time, ensuring continuity of care.

Our mission was to make requiring care and support as stress free as possible by establishing a register of highly skilled and motivated individuals who genuinely enjoyed their role and who would go that extra mile in supporting their clients, who would take the time to listen to their needs and preferences and follow their guidance, who took pride in the level of service they provided.

Locations We Cover: Keynsham, Kingswood, Downend, Hanham, Longwell Green, St Annes, Mangotsfield, Frenchay, Oldland Common, Bitton, St George, Emersons Green, Warmley, Staple Hill, Bridgeyate, North Common and Willsbridge (all in Bristol).

OFFICE OPENING TIMES

Monday: 9am - 5pm
Tuesday: 9am - 5pm
Wednesday: 9am - 5pm
Thursday: 9am - 5pm
Friday: 9am - 5pm
Saturday: Closed
Sunday: Closed

organization.name: Your Care South West Ltd Home Support Services
organization.description:
Your Care, based in the South Glos area of Bristol, is a family-owned and run agency who understand the need for good, supportive care.
Established in 2014, Your Care Home Support Services make a real difference to the way their clients live their lives in Bristol and the surrounding area.

Your care provides services to suit clients from all walks of life and can help those who are struggling to still maintain a good quality of life in their own home, whilst providing companionship along the way.

With an ever-growing team of dedicated Personal Assistants (PA's), who can help you with the smallest of tasks, you are guaranteed to be given the support you or a loved one needs.

All our Personal Assistants (PA's) are rigorously vetted and DBS checked. At Your Care we keep in regular contact with all our clients to make sure that they are happy, and that their needs are being attended to.

So, if you need a little help around the house, with personal care, or want to get out and about but require assistance simply give us a call. We will listen to all your requirements and find a stress-free solution to help.

name: Youth Centres in South Gloucestershire
description:
Youth Centres

South Gloucestershire Council commissions youth activities through four contractors and their subcontractors:

  • FACE
  • Creative Youth Network
  • Learning Partnership West 
  • Diversity Trust. 

More information on specific youth centres in the area including session times, locations and themes is available on their websites below.

What we offer

Our commissioned youth services are all run by appropriately trained staff. Youth workers at both youth centres and within the community work with young people from 13 to 18 years of age (up to 25 years for specialist learning difficulties and/or disability youth services).  Youth workers can provide support and advice for young people on a range of topics such as healthy relationships, accreditation and personal development skills.


Contact details for providers of youth services:


FACE

FACE provides a range of exciting activities for young people at weekly groups and outreach sessions. They run regular children and youth group programmes. FACE - Home (facecharity.org.uk) 


Youth work in Kingswood and Cadbury Heath

Includes Made for Ever Youth Centre, The Batch, Staple Hill YOU Foundation and Little Stoke Youth Centre (The Stokes)

Website: Creative Youth Network

Telephone: 0117 9477948

Activities available include football, cooking, workshops and trips.

Youth work in Yate

Includes Brimsham Green Youth Centre and the Urbie.

Website: Learning Partnership West

Telephone: 0117 987 3700

Activities available include cooking, pool, sports and gaming.

LGBTQ+ provision – area wide

Website: Diversity Trust

Telephone: 0844 800 4425

Diversity Trust manage specialist LGBTQ youth groups services in Kingswood, Patchway and Yate.

Young people with learning difficulties and/or disabilities

Website:  FACE - Home (facecharity.org.uk) 

Telephone: 0117 9691938

FACE have over 30 years' experience working alongside children and young people with learning or social disabilities and are subcontracted by two of the lead providers to deliver youth club sessions in Little Stoke and Kingswood.  LPW provide designated youth sessions within the Yate area for young people with disabilities. 

Other youth provision in South Gloucestershire

Details about activities at other youth centres in South Gloucestershire can be found by visiting the links below:

  • Chipping Sodbury youth centre

organization.name: South Gloucestershire Council
organization.description:
As a unitary authority, South Gloucestershire Council has the powers and functions of both a non-metropolitan county and district council combined. In its capacity as a district council it is a billing authority collecting Council Tax and business rates, it processes local planning applications, and is responsible for housing, waste collection and environmental health. In its capacity as a county council, it is a local education authority, responsible for social services, libraries and waste disposal. 

Full list of contact numbers available: https://beta.southglos.gov.uk/contact-us-by-phone/

name: Youth Visual Impairment Friendly After-School Club
description:
This is our brand new After-School Rowing club for 11 to 18-year-olds with Visual Impairments. Participants will learn fixed-seat rowing in a lightweight rowing boat, Trinity boat, in Bristol Harbour. Volunteers and an Instructor will run this session on Fridays (during term-time) at 5PM to 7PM from end of April to October. 

The session involves participants orientating around the oar and boat and practising stroke before setting off on a trip upriver on Bristol Harbour which cuts through the heart of the city. 

No experience is needed. Buoyancy aids will be provided.

name: Youth Work
description:
The work of FACE is very different at the moment as all of our group session meetings are cancelled following Public Health England and government guidance on stopping the spread of Covid 19.

We are coordinating a volunteer network and shielding helpline and continue to support a few people in our local community who need extra support during lockdowns.

We continue to run a Community Store & Jigsaw Loaning scheme in our Filton foyer, which is open Mondays - Fridays 10am-12pm.

We have been providing a range of resources and outreach activities for our members throughout the past 12 months via zoom, telephone, postal activities, and some groups began social distanced 'meet ups' and youth groups from July 2020 until National lockdown again in November.

We are now working remotely, using Zoom, with a variety of groups across the week for young people from Year 3+, and for young people and adults with social or learning disabilities. Contact us if you need the zoom log-on details.

We are continuing detached and outreach youth work and 1-2-1 support with those who need it.

We expect to re-open centre-based youth provision from 19th April.

organization.name: FACE (Foundation for Active Community Engagement)
organization.description:
Foundation for Active Community Engagement (FACE) is a registered youth & community charity based in Filton, running regular activities for people of all ages and backgrounds across the wider Bristol & South Glos areas. 

Our focus is on supporting people to improve their lives and the community around them; through better skills, knowledge, opportunities, access to wider support, and making a positive difference by being 'active' in their community

name: Zumba Gold with Marie
description: At Avonmouth Community Centre Zumba Gold with Marie Fun for all ages and abilities wanting a low impact but high energy dance fitness class to zingy tunes from around the world! Classes every Monday from 12:15pm for £4 per class. Fees: £4 per class
